subject: Real Estate
title: King Abdullah Economic City
description: One-minute skill: King Abdullah Economic City.

hook.text: Saudi Arabia started building a $100 billion city from nothing in 2005. It was designed for 2 million people.

buildup.text: KAEC was meant to diversify Saudi Arabia's economy away from oil with industry, tourism, and housing.

discovery.text: The city got a port, an industrial zone, and a golf course. What it didn't get was residents.

twist.text: By 2020, only about 10,000 people lived there â€” 0.5% of the target population.

climax.text: KAEC is a cautionary tale: you can build a city, but you can't force people to move there.

punchline.text: You can build a city. You can't build a community.
